answers.answer: Sorry to hear about your stuation. Endocrinologist are tough to get an appt with. They are very busy doctors. Remember ...they deal with many other areas other than thyroid. They have a LOT of diabetes patients. Some people actually have to wait months so a few weeks is not bad. But maybe you could call yourself and explain the situation and see if any cancellations arise. ??goodluck.

calm down if it is thyroid cancer it takes years to cause any problems...cold nodules are possible cancerous but if the nodule is less than 1.5 to 2.5 cm in size its not to horrible..mines 7cm and im just now having symtoms..i know its scary as hell but doctors get over burdened....so..A) ask your regular doctor to order the test... for the results to be ready for the endo..B) track the little symtoms...weight gain?hair loss..?pimples?fatigue?pain in the neck does it spread to your ears?C) get copies of all your results... make sure you have a recent ultrasound and get all the films and all the reults..you should havean ultrasounda iodine uptake testblood work (check for calcium level as well)and a Fine needle asperation biopsyyour regular MD should be able to order all the tests and have you follow up with an endocron.. if the test results come back malignant or suspicus youll be supprised how quickly they get ya in... if it comes back normal you breathe easier..

question: I have a large noldule.  It is solid and shows as a cold nodule.  My blood tests are normal and I show no symptoms of a thyroid hormone imbalance.  My doctor first noticed the nodule about a year ago.  However based on the most recent tests, my doctor has recommended a FNA (fine needle aspiration).  I am scheduled to leave the country for two weeks next Monday.  I have been trying to get an endocrinologist appointment for three days with no luck (my doctor has actually been trying to schedule the appointment for me)-- some endocrinolgists are saying they will not see me for three weeks -- should appointments for biopsies be this hard to make?Even though, I know thyroid cancer is rare - I am very nervous and have trouble dealing with the anxiety while I am waiting.  Any advice on how to deal with the anxiety...
title: Should a biopsy take this long/cannot get appointment with endocrinologist
